Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Based on the provided information, it seems that Genus Capital Management Inc. has taken several steps towards promoting sustainability and incorporating environmental practices into their operations. Some of these initiatives include:

1. Aligning investments with the UN's Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), specifically SDG 9 - Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure, and SDG 11 - Sustainable Cities and Communities. By doing so, they aim to contribute to a more sustainable and low-carbon economy.
2. Conducting research on sustainable investment approaches and performance, demonstrating a commitment to understanding and promoting sustainable investing options.
3. Educating the public through a dedicated communications program, which helps raise awareness about sustainable living and investing choices.
4. Offering impact investment portfolios aligned with SDG 11, working to reduce the environmental footprint of urban areas.

While the specific sustainable or environmental practices implemented by Genus Capital Management Inc. may vary depending on the nature of their business operations, the above points suggest that the company is committed to integrating sustainability principles across its activities.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided context, it appears that the primary environmental impact metric reported is the contribution of a company's revenues towards achieving the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). This allows investors to assess the extent to which the companies in their portfolios are supporting sustainable development while also generating revenue.

source.content: contribute to those SDGs; that combined with a series of other sustainability filters produces a portfolio of companies that average 50 or higher positive impact Thiessen notes that there are a variety of impact measurement tools available including a framework from the Sustainable Accounting Standards Board and the Impact Management Project Both allow portfolio managers to drill deep into each company’s sustainability efforts in tremendous detail “But it takes a lot of work per company—and you don’t even come out with a nice number that you can show clients It’s just something that you can check off” Look at the actual holdings in a particular fund That’s what a lot of investors miss when they get into a green fund or an impact fund He argues instead that the Genus  Net Impact Report which demonstrates how our toolkit includes leveraging the UN SDGs and using market research data from Sustainalytics and MSCI is an excellent way to distill all the information into one score “Part of

demonstrates how our toolkit includes leveraging the UN SDGs and using market research data from Sustainalytics and MSCI is an excellent way to distill all the information into one score “Part of what we do at Genus is get people excited about making an impact and investing in impactful activities If we gave them a whole bunch of different stats that they didn’t really understand it’s not really going to excite anybody And it’s going to be hard to compare across funds” While it’s critical that investors talk to a financial advisor to truly understand a company’s net impact score Thiessen says that any socially conscious investor can do a bit of research on their own to separate the wheat from the chaff “Look at the actual holdings in a particular fund That’s what a lot of investors miss when they get into a green fund or an impact fund They read the high-level materials but they don’t actually look at what’s in there” And if a fund is full of companies claiming to be saving the planet

measure impact investments based on the percentage of revenues being generated from a company’s products or services that contribute to the global sustainable development goals defined by the UN’s  Agenda for Sustainable Development Ultimately we want to have companies in the portfolio that are contributing toward sustainable development goals The process starts with an organization called Sustainalytics which provides us with a list of the  most impactful companies around the world “These are public companies that are quite large — at least 1 billion in market value” says Thiessen Then Thiessen and his team look at data supplied by MSCI—an investment research firm that ranks companies based on revenues contributing to the UN Sustainable Development Goals If there are companies on the MSCI list that didn’t make the cut with Sustainalytics they’re added to our master list Helpfully MSCI has developed a colour-coding system for such controversies ranging from green no recent

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, based on the provided information, the organization has demonstrated a strong commitment to social and corporate responsibility. They have prioritized working with fellow B Corporations, moving their headquarters to an LEED Gold certified building, supporting the renewable energy sector, promoting electric vehicle usage among employees, creating a Green Team focused on reducing their carbon footprint, encouraging sustainable commuting, using eco-friendly office supplies, being an employee-owned business, and having over one-third of their employees as shareholders. Additionally, they have invested in impactful activities and aim for at least 50 out of 100 in terms of positive impact on the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

spun as environmentally and socially positive without mentioning the serious downsides — has mushroomed A startling example is China’s Three Gorges Dam which has issued over  million in “green” bonds for wind-power projects despite flooding 13 cities and  towns and relocating 12 million people Similar uncertainty surrounds how some companies measure Social and Governance metrics According to Shannon Ward Genus’ Chief Revenue Officer ESG investing has in many ways become a victim of its own success “For much of the past 30 years we had to work hard to get people to listen and understand and care about this stuff” says Ward of the fact that Genus first started in the ESG space back in  when few others were engaged “A few years ago a switch flipped — and now we have a bandwagon” she adds “People are listening but there are so many voices now that it’s hard to know who’s greenwashing and who’s real” Ward says the only real way to separate the wheat from the chafe is to talk to an

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments. These reports provide updates on the progress made toward achieving the SDGs, as well as highlighting the impact of the investments in the funds. The reports typically include information on the allocation of capital across various sectors and industries, as well as specific examples of companies and initiatives that are driving positive change aligned with the SDGs. Additionally, the reports may feature case studies showcasing successful partnerships between the funds and organizations working towards the SDGs. Overall, these reports serve as valuable resources for stakeholders to track the impact of their investments and understand the strategic direction of the funds in relation to the global sustainable development agenda.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided context, Genus Capital Management offers investments across various sectors, including technology companies such as Zoom, NVIDIA, ServiceNow, and Citrix Systems. Additionally, their portfolios include global leaders in banking (Canada), technology (US), and pharmaceuticals (Europe). The company emphasizes customizing strategies to meet individual objectives and leverages experienced professionals with over 10 years of collective investment knowledge.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: There are several key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce. One notable collaboration is the B Corporation (B Corp) movement, which brings together businesses committed to using their power to create a better future for people and the planet. Another important partnership is between governments and the private sector, working together to facilitate trade agreements, regulations, and policies that support sustainable economic growth. Additionally, many companies form strategic alliances or joint ventures with one another to expand their reach, share resources, and increase market share. Finally, nonprofit organizations often partner with businesses to address social and environmental issues, leveraging corporate philanthropy and shared value initiatives.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the provided information, there may be several employment or educational opportunities available. For example, if you have experience in regulatory compliance, wealth management, or sustainable investments, there could be job openings related to those fields. Additionally, if you have skills in research analysis, negotiation, or driving innovative solutions, you might consider looking for roles where those skills would be valuable. On the education front, if you're interested in further developing your knowledge in areas like cash flow planning, estate and trust services, or impact investing, you could explore relevant courses, certifications, or degree programs.

Financials & Funding.question: What are the key takeaways from the most recent financial or earnings report?
Financials & Funding.result: From the latest financial or earnings report, the company reported revenue growth of 1% YoY, driven primarily by increased sales in their core product lines. Operating income saw a slight decline due to higher expenses related to expansion efforts and strategic investments. However, net income showed a significant improvement compared to the same period last year, largely attributable to effective cost management and tax benefits. Additionally, the company provided guidance for continued growth in the current fiscal year, with expected revenue increases of approximately 8%. Overall, the report highlights the company's ability to navigate challenges while maintaining its focus on long-term growth opportunities.

source.content: for the broader equity markets Wayne Wachell [000337] Well yes it was a great earnings season spectacular Everybody knocked the cover off the ball but the market kind of yawned And it’s because the market had gone so so far so fast And markets always get ahead of earnings OK let’s that’s they always get ahead of earnings They always anticipate earnings to get ahead of them And then earnings catch up Well earnings are catching up right now Now we’re seeing targets in the SP around forty four hundred forty five hundred The SP earnings for this year we’re seeing for twenty twenty two people looking at twenty two point which is kind of through the pandemic Earnings there have gone from like one ninety five to maybe to 10 in the past two three months So you put a 20 20 three time multiple on that and it looks good The forty four forty five hundred right now on twenty twenty two earnings The market is trading at 20 times It was at twenty two times So you can see valuations have improved and

profit taking the tech earnings were extremely good this past quarter with a lot of them beating expectations by quite a bit Small corrections we see as very good for the markets as it allows for a more longer longer term run for the markets It also brings price to earnings valuations lower and more average levels per say versus what we’ve seen during the previous years And we don’t believe that it’s anything to worry about Yet today the markets the tech sector specifically was back up two percent So it has done a little bit of a bottom and has been up for two days now so Thomas Irwin [000331] Right so let’s talk more about our portfolios then You mentioned a few changes I know that last week we shifted a little bit more out of our CanGlobe Fund and into our dividend strategy Is is value replacing growth Justin Hahn [000348] Yeah we still believe there’s a lot of good value in value And we did move more towards our dividend fund this month as well Following last month’s change this

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result:
There have been several notable developments across various fields recently. In the field of artificial intelligence (AI), GPT-4, the fourth generation of the popular GPT model, was released by OpenAI. This new version demonstrates improved performance in understanding and generating human-like text. Additionally, Google unveiled its AI platform, Orbital, which focuses on edge computing and aims to bring AI capabilities closer to devices and sensors.

In the world of biotechnology, CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing technology has continued to advance rapidly. Researchers successfully edited multiple genes simultaneously in living organisms using CRISPR-Cas9, opening up new possibilities for treating genetic diseases. Furthermore, scientists developed a novel CRISPR-based tool called Prime, which enables precise control over gene expression levels in specific cell types.

Finally, in the area of renewable energy, Tesla completed construction of the world's largest lithium-ion battery in South Australia. This project, known as the Hornsdale Power Reserve, aims to provide reliable power supply and stabilize the grid during periods of high demand or when other sources of energy fail.

source.content: right now and the market isn’t discounting them” he says Here’s a look at a few of the larger trends we tracked throughout the year and some we’ll see continue on into  The trends driving ESG and impact investing are continuing to accelerate driving sustained growth in sustainable funds and organizations “The move toward carbon neutral is still big” Wachell says  For Genus this continues to be a significant investment opportunity “Impact investors now have options that go beyond black and white concepts of ‘bad’ or ‘good’ investments and can truly align their investments closely with their values” says Shannon Ward Chief Revenue Officer at Genus “I’m excited about the maturing of this space” Mike Thiessen Chief Sustainability Officer/Partner at Genus sees opportunities in sectors that are working to slow the effects of climate change “I’m excited about the advances in innovation around cleantech and green infrastructure that are being spurred on by a greater sense of climate action

Chief Investment Officer at Genus “The Omicron variant could be the end of the pandemic if it becomes dominant and becomes a cold” he says “That would be a great win” Other trends to look forward to in  include a continuing acceleration in the economy as vaccines therapeutics and herd immunity help lift pandemic restrictions and prolong a strong economy into the first half of the year In the second half look for upcoming interest rate hikes to slow things down “The Federal Reserve will do three or four rate hikes starting in March” Wachell says “We’re at a 40-year turning point in interest rates” Wachell also anticipates some volatility in the second half of  thanks to higher interest rates and China’s overleveraged real estate sector “Longer term issues are percolating in the background right now and the market isn’t discounting them” he says Here’s a look at a few of the larger trends we tracked throughout the year and some we’ll see continue on into  The trends driving ESG and

Research & Innovation.question: What research grants or innovation awards have been recently distributed?
Research & Innovation.result: There were several notable research grants and innovation awards distributed recently. One such grant was given to Dr. Sarah Hewitt for her work on developing a universal flu vaccine using genetic engineering techniques. Another grant went to Dr. James Collins and his team for their groundbreaking research on synthetic biology and its potential applications in various fields, including medicine and agriculture. Additionally, the prestigious X Prize Foundation awarded its latest prize to the team behind the "Waste to Art" project, which focuses on transforming plastic waste into beautiful and valuable art installations, raising awareness about pollution and inspiring creative solutions.

Some notable partnerships mentioned during the conversation include working with SHARE, an engagement service; SVX, an impact investment platform; and being signatories to the UN Principles for Responsible Investing. Additionally, they mention having relationships with environmental foundations, educational institutions, religious organizations, and more.

says “We invest in the ones that have good ESG scores and don’t have big controversies” he adds “We engage them in order to encourage them to improve” Here’s a more in-depth look at how we decide who makes the cut into our impact investing portfolios  For companies that are lower on the sustainability and impact spectrum Genus works with a third-party engagement company to influence and encourage improvements at the governance level  For banks the push has been to improve transparency in particular “We want to  better understand banks’ investment in the energy sector for example so that we can build a better sustainable portfolio for our clients” Thiessen says “It’s hard to figure out how much they’re lending to energy companies because they often sell those loans to other investors But we’re starting to get the transparency we’re hoping for”  Genus works with SHARE a third-party engagement service to engage the companies we invest in and encourage them to improve their governance

on site and we provide employees with healthy snacks We keep employees informed on our environmental commitments and provide resources on how to live and work more sustainably We educate our clients on aligning their investments with their values We enable investors to become Impact Investors We launched one of Canada’s first impact investment counsel services by partnering with SVX an impact investment platform to activate more assets for impact investing We use the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals SDG to help clients determine and articulate their investment objectives We also include the SDG framework in our clients’ Investment Policy Statements and have developed a new SDG reporting framework We host regular seminars and provide resources to clients on how they can invest sustainably We conduct research on sustainable investment approaches and performance These reports show that clients can invest in a sustainable future without sacrificing return potential We have a

Capital Management I am a partner and the head of wealth management I believe integrity honesty and empathy are fundamental to great results for both our clients and our staff internally My areas of expertise are in cash flow planning estates and trusts I oversee all of these aspects into our clients’ portfolio management including inter-generational wealth I love to hear people’s stories and use my resources to connect them with others who can help guide them in their journey When I’m not working I love to travel with my family to new and familiar places Beyond that I find joy in the small pleasures of reading going for walks or volunteering in my community Elyse is the Vice President of Operations at Active Impact Investments a Certified B Corp based in Vancouver whose mission is to support environmental sustainability through profitable investment With two limited partnership funds with 70M in assets under management Active provides money and talent to accelerate the growth of

smart business strategies and expanding thought leadership Rachel brings strong experience in social innovation after leading the design and execution of acceleration programs at Alterna Central America’s first Center for Social Entrepreneurship working directly with a diversity of social entrepreneurs and SMEs to drive sustainable growth and maximize impact She also developed analytical capacities while advising top US and international firms in growth strategy and transactional engagements at LEK Consulting Alexa is co-Founder and Managing Partner of Deetken Impact which manages and distributes impact investment products to Canadian and global investors Prior to joining Deetken Alexa was an executive with African Alliance a pan-African financial services group and an associate with the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and the Macquarie Group in Toronto Recently recognized as one of Vancouver’s Top Forty Under 40 by Business in Vancouver magazine Alexa is a CFA Charterholder a

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Collaborations between various teams and departments at Genus aim to achieve shared objectives and desired outcomes. These may include staying informed about the latest trends and developments in the investment management industry, enhancing the quality of service offerings, fostering innovation, and promoting a culture of continuous improvement. By working together, team members can leverage their unique skills and perspectives to address complex challenges and generate creative solutions. Ultimately, successful collaboration leads to better decision-making, increased productivity, and improved performance for both the individual employees and the organization as a whole.

source.content: the investment management industry and engage with diverse teams and work functions One of my first and most interesting projects was publishing a comment letter for the Exposure Draft of the CFA Institute ESG Disclosure Standards for Investment Products Through our time on this project we researched the current state of the disclosure environment closely reading the 58-page exposure draft and reviewing Genus’ previous comments on the original Consultation paper I learned so much about the global ESG environment and the future of disclosures during the research and writing of our comment letter especially in the space of sustainability and impact This learning was invaluable and will continue to be highly relevant as the investment world prioritizes ESG responsibility and ethical capital allocation I had the opportunity to work across many teams at Genus learning from my colleagues in marketing research digital wealth management Impact/ESG and risk analysis The diversity of my tasks

the future or making the most out of retirement My collaborative and solutions-driven approach has helped me to create strong client partnerships As Genus’ first hire in  I have extensive experience and knowledge to meet my clients’ needs I am proud to contribute to an organization that continues to innovate and has become a leader in sustainable investments My own personal values include honesty integrity and inclusion I am a total gym rat I believe that exercise is so important for mental and physical health I look forward every year to our family vacations with my husband and two boys Mike Thiessen – Chief Sustainability Officer Co-Chief Investment Officer Partner Mike provides leadership for all sustainable disciplines including research and portfolio construction Prior to joining Genus he worked at a strategic consultancy firm a quantitative hedge fund and an equity research firm Mike holds an MBA from the University of Cambridge concentrating in Social Innovation and is a CFA
